imdb_user_reviews.contents: A Forgettable  Movie Lacking Any New Storyline

Terrible, forced, cringe inducing pile of garbage
I can't imagine kids will even enjoy this one...
Lots of jokes about nuts and nothing else
this movie sucks, but boy is it a masterpiece
I watched this so I could review it
The Nut Job Review by Matt
Going for the nuts (or "'Your nuts?' 'No you are'")
You'd Be Nutty Not To Enjoy This Film
Well done... best animated movie from south Korean  animator
Despite the medium's namesake, animation fails to bring this story to life.
Barring the first quarter, a borefest
Ups and down of the movie
Run-of-the-mill, but watchable animated robbery caper.
Hollow and deeply uninteresting to both kids and adults
Atrocious excuse to capitalize on kid's film market
Full of corny antics, like most CGI movies with animals
Corporate executives thinking they know what kids want
One of the least engaging animated films in quite some time
Funny in a Squirrelly Kind of Way
Only the humans in this movie are amusing
Entertaining, well done, but more than subtly political
A boring animated film made at the wrong time
What an initially strange, but ultimately satisfying film this is!
I am really surprised its decent!
Sooooo, this is different. You will either find it likable or walk out
"The Constitution is not a Suicide Pact . . . "

mc_pro_critic_reviews.summary: A delightfully goofy slapstick cartoon with a surprisingly dark heart.

While the animation is quite good and the filmmakers have brought together an excellent group of actors to provide the voice talent, the storyline leaves us with a tale more reminiscent of Saturday morning kids’ programming.

The Nut Job has an interesting anti-socialist subtext, with the seemingly benevolent raccoon revealing himself as a power-mad dictator. It’s the most political non-Pixar cartoon feature since the very left-leaning “The Ant Bully’’ eight years ago.

Better than any animated film released in the doldrums of January has a
right to be.

Given the feel-good themes of the average kids' movie — be yourself, follow the golden rule, love each other, blah blah blah — it's refreshing to see an animated comedy chuck that guck and focus on a real jerk.
Too bad that the makers of The Nut Job eagerly purloined Scrat's primal motivation—food—but failed to note the charm of his minimalist approach.
The Nut Job has a certain lo-fi charm, but it’s hardly a world-beater; with all due respect to Surly, Rocky J. Squirrel’s place in the pantheon would seem to be safe for another 50 years.
Sometimes the punch lines land and sometimes they don’t, but overall the result is pleasantly nostalgic.
Forgettably mediocre, but it's not atrocious.
The production squeaks by on the visual charm of art director Ian Hastings’ period touches and warm autumnal hues. The voice talent is a decidedly mixed bag.
The absence of new or sustainable ideas dooms it to instant mediocrity.
Endless wordplay and dumb slapstick do not a rewarding animation make. Pun-ishing.
Once the opening credits end, it turns out The Nut Job"= is far more "Romper Room" than "Step Brothers."
The Nut Job features decent CG animation, especially of animals, but the writing isn't particularly clever, relying on obvious puns and slapstick humor.

The Nut Job features muddy-colored and often ugly animation, a plot that feels too stretched out and loaded with details to hold the attention of most children, and more flatulence jokes than anyone deserves.
Focused mostly on one location, the cartoon is stuffed with exhausting visual mayhem. Some jokes land, but most kids over 10 will roll their eyes.
The richly hued CG animation is quite nice – a mix of hyperdetailed character work and painterly cityscapes and pastorals – and the script putters along with small but regular amusements.

Peter Lepeniotis’ animated film brings together a good cast, including Will Arnett, Brendan Fraser and Liam Neeson, which sounds like a sweet deal. But it places them in an uninspired little movie about selfish behavior, which, while overcome (of course), never really manages to escape its bitter roots.
Good-natured and completely forgettable.
The critters look cute, but behave less so, while the competing-heists concept never quite takes off.
Despite some high-caliber voice talent and shimmering animation, it's hard to get a bead on this tale.
This dead-on-arrival ’toon is some of the worst p.r. for rodents since bubonic plague hit medieval Europe.
The plot doesn’t take clever turns, the visual thrills aren’t all that thrilling, and you’re ultimately left to get your heist-movie kicks elsewhere.
Even at 86 minutes, with plenty of chases and action sequences thrown in, The Nut Job feels overstretched and arbitrary.
Big problem straight off: tone. The violence isn't slapsticky; it's just violent.
There's no personality in the design or the script, which only renders the cynical aftertaste of this convoluted one-squirrel-against the-world story all the more potent.
Relentlessly awful.
The most egregious problem with The Nut Job is how shamelessly it fills in the gaps left by expanding Lepeniotis’ short with generic and tedious rogue-to-hero cliché.

mc_user_reviews.text: It's not great, it's not awful, but it is awfully forgettable.  Generic and predictable storyline that has some pretty severe pacing problems in filling out its runtime and lots of name-recognized actors who do not get used to their full potential.  But the end result isn't terrible, just mediocre.  A few of the gags did get laughs, but on the whole it's a January theater space occupier release that accomplishes just that.
It is such a shame that so beautiful CGI is wasted on an unfunny generic mess, I guess little children might enjoy this, but still this is really a pain to sit through.

Though it is a story about animals, it is just too ridiculous to follow. The story line was boring and poorly developed. I kept hoping for something positive to come out of this movie, but it didn't happen. I love animated films, but not this one. Highly disappointed!

I didn’t think that the nut job was all that bad. When I saw it I was going in expecting something horrible but no it really surprised me and I honestly think it was ok maybe even good. The animation was ok the story was well paced but weak and generic over all. The main character was a bit too much of an a$% but not so that he was unlikeable. The side characters were fun and enough to balance out his negativity the notable ones are buddy as a faithful sidekick and precious who’s dynamic with the main character and personality had me laughing more than once. The main antagonist was bland but not distractingly so. All in all the movie is pretty bland with few weaknesses but takes no risks.

This movie is not good at all!!! Sound Mixing for the characters are bad there not both left and the right speaker. Every time they move to left or right. It goes to the right or left speaker. The mouse, does not speak at all expect in the end. Voices are not right for the movie. A dog is a boy! Not a girl! Don't watch the movie at all! But the Script and animation is pretty good.
I do not want to see that movie. It's so boring and i'm too bored about that. "The Nut Job" will be the worst movie ever and given two thumbs way DOWN!

"The Nut Job" was actually pretty good and definitely hilarious. i mean, yea i gotta admit: the story's been done over 200 times before, it's a bit too fast and Surly isn't as likeable as i wanted him to be, but look on the bright side. they did try. the animation was surprisingly really good. the colors are nice and vivid, with some really good 3D too (like when the tree explodes, the nuts and acorns look like they're about to hit your face, it was realistic). the voice acting was good too, but i gotta say: the one who totally stole the show for me was Maya Rudolph as Precious the pug. i'm not saying that just cause i love pugs, but cause Maya Rudolph really knows how to handle a voice role. she does that here and it's great, i really liked it. and i laughed a lot in this movie, and i wasn't the only one. everybody in the theater i was in, they all laughed out loud. it was a hilarious movie and we all liked it. so if u want 87 minutes of laughs, good humor, nice voice acting and a smart premise, go check out The Nut Job. no matter how much bad review it got, i still recommend it. it's a good movie

I really liked this movie though the story is a little bit predictable it was still very fun, exciting and hilarious nothing like Over the Hedge i thought that movie sucked but that 's just my opinion.

"The Nut Job" was actually pretty good and definitely hilarious. i mean, yea i gotta admit: the story's been done over 200 times before, it's a bit too fast and Surly isn't as likeable as i wanted him to be, but look on the bright side. they did try. the animation was surprisingly really good. the colors are nice and vivid, with some really good 3D too (like when the tree explodes, the nuts and acorns look like they're about to hit your face, it was realistic). the voice acting was good too, but i gotta say: the one who totally stole the show for me was Maya Rudolph as Precious the pug. i'm not saying that just cause i love pugs, but cause Maya Rudolph really knows how to handle a voice role. she does that here and it's great, i really liked it. and i laughed a lot in this movie, and i wasn't the only one. everybody in the theater i was in, they all laughed out loud. it was a hilarious movie and we all liked it. so if u want 87 minutes of laughs, good humor, nice voice acting and a smart premise, go check out The Nut Job. no matter how much bad review it got, i still recommend it. it's a good movie

It's no Over the Hedge, but it's still a fairly entertaining movie about animals stealing food. I think kids will find it enjoyable, and I see no reason why parents would hate it. Yes it's not up to the quality of a Pixar or DreamWorks animated movie, but I do not believe in will make older audiences miserable.

The Nut Job actually got a theatrical release. The film is of poor quality making it questionable why it wasn’t released straight to DVD. The Nut Job is plagued by the typical problems children’s films face such as two-dimensional characters, bad jokes, and a unoriginal story. The writers half-ass that department as expected but unlike some films which have decent/really good animation to make up for it (ex. The Lorax, Free Birds) the animation is awful. This film isn’t Foodfight level of bad as nothing in here is offensive or obnoxious and young children may be mildly entertained by the film but is upsetting to see a studio release something in theaters without putting any effort into it. The film is of such low quality that it doesn’t deserve a theatrical release and should’ve gone straight to DVD where most low quality films are sent. Even then its not something that is worth sitting through. I feel bad for all the parents who had to sit through this film and shudder at the thought that this film is getting a sequel.

Seriously, the worst animated film I have seen in years.  My kids hated it and wanted me to turn it off and rewatch other movies instead.  I made them finish it, but just horrible.  Stupid story.  Terrible characters and acting.  Yes, the voices in this movie actually annoyed me.  That's saying something.  Whoever made this I think just had one small idea and thought they can make a mint on it.
The Nut Job:
i looked at the trailer  for nut job i am not gonna see it because why you see a  squirrel trying to steal nuts . we all seen these animals take nuts and it is easy  .
The Nut Job es una película de animación que si bien no se complementa del todo, puede llegar a ser entretenida.

Okay, some jokes were funny, but the rest is horrible. I mean, how hard is it to get nuts? It's not like you'll die trying to get food. And the Raccoon--typical. If it weren't for Heigl's voice, this movie would have been downright boring.

This was an O.K.  The animation was well done and the main concept of the plot was clever.  Unfortunately the movie was not funny.  The children are not exposed to any positive ethical values other than the spirit of  "team work".  Kids will like this film but they will not really gain anything.
The Nut Job is one of the worst movies i have ever watched. Nuff said. Oh And by the way Open Road Films if your reading this MAKE A BETTER MOVIE And hire some good voice actors for once.
"The Nut Job" 10 Scale Rating: 3.5 (Bad) ...

The Nut Job it's as terrible as it sounds.You would think that a 2014 animation would be better or at least better looking but no.How came up with this idea in the first place,or even a better question Who approved this movie in the first place anyway ?

This by far is one of the worst movies I have ever seen. It's not funny, Buddy is a ripoff of Remy from Ratatouille (except he talks as much as Chell from Portal), Surly is a PURPLE squirrel who is very egotistical, it was made in 2014, but it referenced Gangnam Style like- crazy, it's poorly animated, it's boring, that's all I can say. I wouldn't watch this movie even if it had a reward of going to Disney World for free.
WTF is everyone complaining about. it is a good movie the plot is simple and I love the characters and everyone who hated on this movie should be ashamed to underrated a good animated movie.

It's time to call off the job as Surly and friends learn how to make a movie with great respect and not make another movie like this. As the sequel occurs, hopes are that a third one won't happen ever.

Bad, generic boring and predictable are words to describe the nut job You have an unlikable main character who your supposed to feel bad for as soon as things go wrong with him. Then you meet the villains the hero kinda redeems himself and then your supposed to be happy but you can't. This time of redemption of a character was not done the right way. Also the animation was bad. There was not enough source material to cover the entire movie and the voice acting was not very at all. Don't even rent this movie it's that bad and forgettable.
The movie might have been cheesy with the dullest animation in the world ever. However, it's humorous, easy to teach people on not being selfish and probably watchable.

Park creatures are the focus of this animal based adventure, well park creatures and some woodland creatures it seems. So its kinda like 'Over the Hedge' but just nowhere near as good or funny. For some unknown reason the movie is set in 1959 although I had no clue to this whilst watching, I just thought it was the artistic style for quirkiness. All these little mammals live in or near a big tree within a park, winter is coming and they gotta collect nuts to survive. I kinda always thought that was a squirrel thing but in this movie raccoon's moles birds etc...all seem to want nuts too.

It's no Over the Hedge, but it's still a fairly entertaining movie about animals stealing food. I think kids will find it enjoyable, and I see no reason why parents would hate it. Yes it's not up to the quality of a Pixar or DreamWorks animated movie, but I do not believe in will make older audiences miserable. The movie has got a great voice cast full of some big name actors. The animation is pretty bad though, as the human characters and backgrounds just look gross. The animals actually look pretty good, but it's often hard to notice that given how ugly the world around them is. As far as humor and story goes, both are up to snuff and are entertaining enough to keep you engaged, even if neither are particularly revolutionary. I do feel it can be surprisingly violent though, and not in a slapstick sort of way. It can almost seem mean at times. All in all it's a decent animated kids movie that I do not feel will make viewers miserable in any way. Kids are most likely going to get quite a few laughs out of it, and adults shouldn't have to worry about staying awake through it.

Though it is a story about animals, it is just too ridiculous to follow. The story line was boring and poorly developed. I kept hoping for something positive to come out of this movie, but it didn't happen. I love animated films, but not this one. Highly disappointed!
